snippet: Congressional action is desperately needed to save the mail system. But will lawmakers do the right thing in an election year, or let the service sink further?
abstract: Editorial urges Congress to act quickly to enact Postmaster General Patrick Donahoe's proposed reforms for the troubled postal system; notes that money-saving measures, including numerous closures and a move to a five-day delivery system, are essential in light of the system's $1 billion monthly deficit.
lead_paragraph: Congressional action is desperately needed to save the mail system. But will lawmakers do the right thing in an election year, or let the service sink further?
